title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Stock futures slide while gold and silver jump after Powell investigation raises fears over the Fed’s independence
items.description: Powell said the investigation rests on “pretexts,” arguing it's retaliation for the Fed’s refusal to follow the Trump's preferences on interest rates.

items.title: Iran Prepared for War but Ready to Negotiate With U.S., Foreign Minister Says
items.description: The comments came after President Trump said he was “ looking at some very strong options” to curb Iran’s harsh repression of antigovernment protests.

items.title: One reason CEOs tie layoffs to AI? It motivates remaining employees to adopt the technology
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

items.title: Nikki Glaser’s Monologue, Teyana Taylor’s Speech and Other Moments From the 2026 Globes
items.description: Nikki Glaser returned as host and killed, while Teyana Taylor delivered the speech of the night. Then there were those awful production choices.

items.title: Nearly 15,000 Nurses Go on Strike at Major New York City Hospitals
items.description: Workers are demanding more robust staffing levels and higher pay. The strike comes three years after a smaller job action won significant gains.

items.title: The Justice Department’s New Target in D.C., and a Surge of Federal Agents in Minnesota
items.description: Plus, Russia’s push to indoctrinate Ukrainian kids.

items.title: Malaysia and Indonesia move to ban Musk’s Grok AI over sexually explicit deepfakes

items.title: U.S. Citizens Are Joining the Military to Protect Undocumented Parents
items.description: Amid an ICE crackdown in her area, an Oregon National Guard recruiter offers U.S. citizens a way to save their immigrant parents.

items.title: DOJ probe on Powell draws swift backlash from Congress as key GOP senator says he won’t confirm anyone for the Fed until case is resolved

items.title: ‘Sell America’: Investors dump U.S. assets in fear of the end of Fed independence
items.description: Wall Street analysts are almost universally negative about the news.

items.title: Death Toll Surges in Iran Protests
items.description: Crowds gathered at a morgue outside Tehran as the death toll from protests in Iran surged. President Trump hinted on Sunday that the United States may...

items.title: Russian Missiles Failed in Venezuela During U.S. Attack
items.description: The Venezuelan regime had high-powered air defense systems from its allies in the Kremlin, but failed to set much of it up.

items.title: Two Months After Cease-Fire, Israel Is Still Demolishing Gaza
